title: What do you think of the song 'Schism' by Tool? - Quora

response.answer_text: Like most of MJK’s music, the lyrics are so complex that it Is hard to be positive what it is about. I think that there are two possible stories behind the song. The first is about how religion creates a division amongst all of us. Religion played an important part in Maynard's childhood and not in a good way. But most likely it is about the separation between two people through a break up or divorce. For example the lyrics “I know the pieces fit 'cause I watched them tumble down No fault, none to blame, it doesn't mean I don't desire to Point the finger, blame the other, watch the temple topple over. To bring the pieces back together, rediscover communication” The two people most likely separated mutually from growing apart and distancing themselves from each other. He knows that they could be good together but he watched them slowly desperate do to lack of communication. But admittedly blames the other person even though he knows it isn't completely their fault.
